page.title: 04Wotter ecology
page.content: Most of the higher ground is divided into small grass fields by Devon banks,but a patch to the north east is wild moorland and derelict china clay tips onto which moorland vegetation has encroched. Besides tough grasses rushes and bracken there is some heather and whortleberry. Near Wotter there are very few trees exept for a group of Scots pines and hawthorn. Southwest winds bring rain often with a cloud base below the village. There is no shelter from the cold east winds and little from from the north. The combined effect of these weather conditions is deterrent to gardening. Bickleigh is much lower and more sheltered and has both and good gardens.
